source.name: Administrative Law Judge Opinions on Civil Penalties issued by the Federal Aviation Administration
source.description: Under Federal regulation 14 C.F.R. '§13.202, the Administrator of the FAA serves as the "decisionmaker" on appeals from the decisions of the Department of Transportation administrative law judges in civil penalty cases. Under Federal regulation 14 C.F.R. '§13.203, the Adjudication Branch along with the Assistant Chief Counsel for Litigation, advises the Administrator on such matters.
